City

Your cities are the basis of your empire. Each city has a certain amount of population and many tiles, and can work as many tiles as it has population.
The center tile of a city is always worked and does not require population.
New Cities can be constructed by building a Settler.
Each city your empire has removes 3 Happiness from the empire, and each population - another 1 Happiness, so plan carefully!
Tile

Tiles are areas where your population can work the land.
Every tile has a base terrain, such as Grassland, Tundra etc, and some have terrain overlays, like Hill, Forest etc.
Depending on the terrain, tiles can hold tile resources.
Each tile can have one improvement at anny given time.
Population

Represents the number of people in your city, who can work the city's tiles.
Population grows by having enough surplus food, and will shrink if there isn't enough food to go around.
Each Population consumes 2 Food per turn.
When a new population is added, it will automatically work the tile producing the most food.
You can manually assign population to tiles by clicking the population icon on a tile - you'll have to remove a population from a tile to assign it somewhere else!
Basic Resources

There are 6 basic resources in Civ: Food, Production, Gold, Science, Happiness and Culture.Production and Food are per individual city, while the other resources are empire-wide.Basic resources are produced by working city tiles and by buildings.
Food

A basic resource. Each city can store surplus food.
When the surplus food reaches a certain amount dependant on the population, it is consumed and the city gains another population.
If all the suplus food is depleted, and there is a food shortage, the city will lose a population.
Production

A basic resource. Production is used to build buildings and units in the city.
Each idle population (not working a tile) produces 1 production.
Science

A basic resource. Represents the scientific advancement of your empire.
Each Technology requires a certain amount of Science, which increases as the technologies become more advanced.
Each Population produces 1 Science.
Gold

A basic resource. Represents the wealth of your empire.
Most buildings have mainainance costs, which require Gold per turn.
Every turn you are in a gold deficit, you will lose science points equal to your debt, which can halt your scientific advancement entirely!
Cities connected to the capital by roads will generate gold from the trade route, so connect your larg cities to the capital!
Happiness

A basic resource.
Each city decreases your empire's happiness by 3, and each population by 1.
You can increase your happiness by buildings, or by working Luxury resources.
When in an unhappy state, your surplus food added is reduced to 1/4, dramatically slowing your city growth.
When enough Happiness is accrued, your empire will enter a Golden Age!
Capturing Cities

Cities can be conquered by reducing their health to 1, and entering the city with a melee unit.
Since cities heal each turn, it is best to attack with ranged units  and use your melee units to defend them until the city has been defeated!
